docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama on Saturday encouraged supporters to be politically active, saying that he plans to remain so when his presidency concludes and declared, "I'm just getting started."

headline.main: Obama Urges Supporters to Stay Engaged, Says He Will Too

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama on Saturday encouraged supporters to be politically active, saying that he plans to remain so when his presidency concludes and declared, "I'm just getting started."

docs.lead_paragraph: Mattie Jackson's screened porch has an open-door policy. Relatives and friends are likely to walk up at any time and take a seat on the green iron furniture next to the woman known best as "Miss Mattie" in southeast Atlanta's Peoplestown neighborhood.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new proposed contract gives entry-level workers a path to achieve wage parity with veteran employees.

headline.main: U.A.W. Chief Expects Deal on Contract at Chrysler
headline.print_headline: U.A.W. Chief Expects Deal on Contract at Chrysler

docs.abstract: United Automobile Workers president Dennis Williams says he thinks workers at Fiat Chrysler will accept more generous contract proposal after rejecting previous version.
docs.snippet: The new proposed contract gives entry-level workers a path to achieve wage parity with veteran employees.

byline.contributor: Mary M. Chapman contributed reporting from Detroit.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since taking over the United States Chamber of Commerce in 1997, Thomas Donohue has transformed the organization into a powerful ally of tobacco.

headline.main: Big Tobacco’s Staunch Friend in Washington: U.S. Chamber of Commerce
headline.print_headline: Big Tobacco’s Powerful Friend in Washington

docs.abstract: Thomas J Donohue, United States Chamber of Commerce chief executive and staunch supporter of tobacco industry, is heading campaign to convince countries around world to roll back antismoking legislation; leader's path to power, which has transformed Chamber into largest US lobbying group, is chronicled.
docs.snippet: Since taking over the United States Chamber of Commerce in 1997, Thomas Donohue has transformed the organization into a powerful ally of tobacco.

byline.contributor: Douglas Dalby contributed reporting from Dublin, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Claims Victory on Coal Miner Bankruptcy Settlement

docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton claimed a victory of sorts, as a coal company backed away from a deal that would have used $18 million intended for the health care costs of retired miners to pay for lawyers and costs dealing with bankruptcy.
docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton claimed a victory of sorts, as a coal company backed away from a deal that would have used $18 million intended for the health care costs of retired miners to pay for lawyers and costs dealing with bankruptcy.

docs.lead_paragraph: United Auto Workers President Dennis Williams on Friday said that the new proposed four-year contract with Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV gives lower paid workers a clearer path to top pay.

headline.main: Proposed Fiat Chrysler Pact Gives Path to Top Pay-Union Chief
headline.print_headline: Proposed Fiat Chrysler Pact Gives Path to Top Pay-Union Chief

docs.lead_paragraph: The House Budget Committee approved Republican legislation Friday that would scuttle President Barack Obama's health care law, block federal payments to Planned Parenthood — and likely lead to a presidential veto.

headline.main: House Bill Targets Health Law, Planned Parenthood Funds
headline.print_headline: House Bill Targets Health Law, Planned Parenthood Funds

docs.snippet: The House Budget Committee approved Republican legislation Friday that would scuttle President Barack Obama's health care law, block federal payments to Planned Parenthood — and likely lead to a presidential veto.

docs.lead_paragraph: Responding to criticism from civil liberties advocates, the Obama administration said Friday it has strengthened consumer privacy protections on the government's health insurance website as a new sign-up season nears.

headline.main: US Boosts Privacy Protection on Health Insurance Website

docs.lead_paragraph: Voters in the majority-black city of Memphis have tapped a city councilman to become their first white mayor in nearly a quarter-century, rebuffing a three-term incumbent whose campaign sagged under rising crime, poverty and the troubled finances of this gritty Mississippi River community.

headline.main: Vote: Councilman to Become Memphis' 1st White Mayor Since 91
headline.print_headline: Vote: Councilman to Become Memphis' 1st White Mayor Since 91
